item.description:
Tuesday, February 15, 2011 (RESCHEDULED)
6:30 PM Potluck, 7:15 PM Slideshow
AMC's Cabot Auditorium
4 Joy Street, Boston, MA

Mongolia sounds exotic, but it's easier and less expensive than you may think to do-it-yourself. On her first-ever sojourn abroad, Sage Cohen spent three months traveling Mongolia with a bicycle. She spent the subsequent two summers there, traveling by four hooves and a thumb. This slide show (yes, real Kodak slides!) opens a view on the landscape, people and culture of this Central Asian land, including a composite of her many weeks exploring the country by horse. Sage Cohen has become an intrepid traveler since her 40th birthday. She has traveled by bicycle in Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, Pakistan, India, China, Tibet, Latvia and Southeast Asia. Mongolia was her first love.

If you plan to attend, please RSVP to Julie LePage at AMCBostonSlideshows@gmail.com.

For those who wish to participate in the potluck at 6:30, feel free to use the following guidelines: Last names beginning with M-Z bring a main dish or side dish, last names beginning with A-L bring an appetizer or dessert. Homemade dishes are great, store bought goodies & takeout are equally welcome:) Plates, bowls, cups, cutlery, napkins and drink pitchers will be supplied. The auditorium has a kitchen if you need to do any re-warming or prep (stovetop, oven, microwave, sink, fridge, etc).

Subway Directions: Take the Red Line T to Park Street Station and walk through the Boston Common uphill towards the State House & Beacon Street. Continue walking up Joy Street, which runs along the left side of the State House at a set of lights. The Auditorium is #4 Joy Street (just before the AMC Headquarters Building, on the left side).

In the event of a schedule change or cancellation, an email will be sent out to those who RSVP.
item.name: DIY Mongolia (Potluck & Slideshow)
